divs: sighting detailsthe aforementioned object comes down from the night sky vertically and hovers approximately 5' of the gound, just on the side of a small hill. i climb the hill and make the following observations from 15' away: 1. oval object with a secondary oval rise begining approximately 4' from outermost edge; and, rising for a total approximate height of 10';and, being 25-30' in width. 2. color grayish black \ compare same to todays stealh fighter. 3. appears metalic but the component manufacture is something else. 4. the object has a low pitched repetive sound going in pitch from low to a higher audible *(similar to an air conditioner in volume and pitch) 5. the base of the object has circular lights that upon entry and departure are bright white light(s)*the lights intensity is such that the same object appeared as one bright light from a distance. 6. objects bottom has round lights that are equally spaced and follow the oval completing a circle. 7. the object when hovering changed its light configuration from white lights to multi colored lights. 8. when hovering each light pulsates off and on with a colored light in sequence with the pitch and\or whiring sound of the object *this is to say the audible pitch from low to high generates a pulsation with light.the colored lights also change their positions, where one was blue on the begining sequence the same light could next be red and so on.the lights on and off sequnce follows the oval of the object and takes approximately 5-6 seconds to complete the circle. 9. the multi color lights are for that time the most fantastic colors i have ever observed and today i know them as mauve colors and\or similar. 10. object changes light configuaration back to white lights and begins to rise vertically until reaching an approximate height of 400'. the object then accelerates heading north at a spead that would be comparable to a falling star and disapears. note: initial witnesses approx.100 people \ remaining for the entirety of the event 2\ the first to exit - police\ media reports a large number of phone calls to local police \ air force official report weather baloon
